Package wizard

Class WizardBuilder

java.lang.Object
wizard.WizardBuilder
public class WizardBuilder extends Object
Performs real-time validation of data entered by the user and converts the object representation of school data to a JSON string.

  • Constructor Details

    • WizardBuilder

      public WizardBuilder()

  • Method Details

    • build

      public static Map<String,Object> build(String firstDayTag, String lastDayTag, String timezone, List<EditorEntry> periods, List<EditorEntry> days, List<EditorEntry> weeks, List<EditorEntry> weekExceptions)
      Builds a final JSON-like structure using the java.util data structures. This method assumes that all arguments represent valid data as determined by the validator methods in this class.
      Parameters:
      firstDayTag - the date of the first day of school from the InfoEditor.
      lastDayTag - the date of the last day of school from the InfoEditor.
      timezone - the unix TZ identifier from the InfoEditor.
      periods - a list of Periods.
      days - a list of Days.
      weeks - a list of Weeks.
      weekExceptions - a list of WeekExceptions.
      Returns:
      a hashmap that can be parsed to a JSON string, which represents the final output from the data generator.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any argument is null.

    • validateInfo

      public static String validateInfo(String firstDayTag, String lastDayTag)
      Validates data from the "Info" section of the data generator. Any errors are returned as a single string with entries separated by a newline character. If no errors are found, null is returned. The checks performed include:
      • firstDayTag <= lastDayTag
      Parameters:
      firstDayTag - the date of the first day of school from the InfoEditor.
      lastDayTag - the date of the last day of school from the InfoEditor.
      Returns:
      messages describing validation errors, or null if validation was successful.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any argument is null.

    • periodToJson

      public static Map<String,String> periodToJson(EditorEntry period, List<EditorEntry> periods)
      Converts a Period object to a JSON representation. If any argument is null, then null is returned.
      Parameters:
      period - the Period object to convert.
      periods - the list of all Period objects.
      Returns:
      a hashmap that can be converted to a JSON string representing this period.

    • validatePeriodList

      public static String validatePeriodList(List<EditorEntry> periods)
      Validates data from the "Periods" section of the data generator. Any errors are returned as a single string with entries separated by a newline character. If no errors are found, null is returned. The checks performed include:
      • At least one period has type == "Academic"
      • No duplicate names exist
      Parameters:
      periods - the list of all Period objects.
      Returns:
      messages describing validation errors, or null if validation was successful.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if periods == null.

    • dayToJson

      public static Map<String,Object> dayToJson(EditorEntry day, List<EditorEntry> allPeriodEntries)
      Converts a Day object to a JSON representation. If any argument is null, then null is returned.
      Parameters:
      day - the Day object to convert.
      allPeriodEntries - the list of all Period objects.
      Returns:
      a hashmap that can be converted to a JSON string representing the specified day.

    • validateDayList

      public static String validateDayList(List<EditorEntry> days, List<EditorEntry> allPeriodEntries)
      Validates data from the "Days" section of the data generator. Any errors are returned as a single string with entries separated by a newline character. If no errors are found, null is returned. The checks performed include:
      • No duplicate names exist
      • All periods referenced in a given day exist
      • Every day has at least one period
      • All periods referenced in a given day have startTime > endTime
      • For each period, p[n], in a day, p[n].endTime <= p[n+1].startTime
      Parameters:
      days - the list of all Day objects.
      allPeriodEntries - the list of all Period objects.
      Returns:
      messages describing validation errors, or null if validation was successful.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any argument is null.

    • weekToJson

      public static Map<String,Object> weekToJson(EditorEntry week)
      Converts a Week object to a JSON representation. If any argument is null, then null is returned.
      Parameters:
      week - the Week object to convert.
      Returns:
      a hashmap that can be converted to a JSON string representing this week.

    • validateWeekList

      public static String validateWeekList(List<EditorEntry> weeks, List<EditorEntry> allDayEntries)
      Validates data from the "Weeks" section of the data generator. Any errors are returned as a single string with entries separated by a newline character. If no errors are found, null is returned. The checks performed include:
      • No duplicate names exist
      • A week with the name "DEFAULT" exists
      • All days referenced in a given week exist
      • Every week has exactly seven days
      Parameters:
      weeks - the list of all Week objects.
      allDayEntries - the list of all Day objects.
      Returns:
      messages describing validation errors, or null if validation was successful.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any argument is null.

    • weekExceptionToJson

      public static Map<String,String> weekExceptionToJson(EditorEntry weekException)
      Converts a WeekException object to a JSON representation. If any argument is null, then null is returned.
      Parameters:
      weekException - the WeekException object to convert.
      Returns:
      a hashmap that can be converted to a JSON string representing this week exception.

    • validateWeekExceptionList

      public static String validateWeekExceptionList(List<EditorEntry> weekExceptions, List<EditorEntry> allWeekEntries)
      Validates data from the "Exceptions" section of the data generator. Any errors are returned as a single string with entries separated by a newline character. If no errors are found, null is returned. The checks performed include:
      • The week referenced in a given week exception exists
      Parameters:
      weekExceptions - the list of all WeekException objects.
      allWeekEntries - the list of all Week objects.
      Returns:
      messages describing validation errors, or null if validation was successful.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any argument is null.
